intro: Boechera drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Boechera drummondii is also noted for its ability to tolerate drought conditions.
